    • Constructor Detail

      • UCS

        public UCS(java.lang.String configFile)

        Initializes an UCS object. It configures the UCS run reading the configuration file.

        Parameters:
        configFile - is the name of the config file.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        It runs the system.

      • startTrainUCS

        public void startTrainUCS()
        Runs one UCS train experiment. It creates a new population and calls the function doOneTrainExperiment. It makes explore and exploit iterations. It also updates time statistics.

      • doOneTrainExperiment

        public void doOneTrainExperiment(int[] globalResults)
        Runs one train UCS experiment. Now, in the train run, one exploit is done between N explores (where N is a parameter defined by the user). So, the operators of covering, the GA and the update parameters routines are called in the explore runs.
        Parameters:
        globalResults - contains the addition of all classified, not classified and correct and wrong classified examples of the exploit executions in the train.

      • doOneTestExperiment

        public void doOneTestExperiment(Environment tEnv,
                                int typeOfTest,
                                int[] globalResults,
                                boolean writeExpOut)

        Performs a test experiment. It does not apply the covering operator, the GA and the update parameters routines. It only creates the match set and the prediction array, choosing the best action. If there are more than one action with the same probability, it chooses one of them randomly. For the moment, the examples are chosen sequentially from the environment if it's a file single step environment, to be sure that all the examples will participate in the test run.

        Parameters:
        tEnv - is the environment to do the test. It can be the same or different from the train environment.
        typeOfTest - is a parameter that indicates the kind of test: testing with the test set (0) or testing with the train set (1)
        globalResults - contains the addition of all classified, not classified and correct and wrong classified examples of the exploit executions in the train.

      • doOneSingleStepExplore

        public void doOneSingleStepExplore(double[] envState,
                                   int classOfExample,
                                   int tStamp)

        Performs one explore iteration. It applies the covering operator, the GA and the update parameters routines if it is necessary.

        Parameters:
        envState - is the new example that has to be classified.
        tStamp - is the current time stamp of the system. It is used to decide if the GA has to be applied, and to create new classifiers.

      • doOneSingleStepExploit

        public void doOneSingleStepExploit(double[] envState,
                                   int classOfExample,
                                   int tStamp,
                                   int[] windowExecutionResults,
                                   boolean isTest,
                                   int typeOfTest,
                                   boolean writeExpOut)

        Performs one single step exploit. It only chooses the best prediction from the prediction array (it is not stochastic)

        Parameters:
        envState - is the new example that has to be classified.
        tStamp - is the current time stamp of the system. It's used to decide if the GA has to be applied, and to create new classifiers.
        windowExecutionResults - is an array where the results are set down to make statistics.
        typeOfTest - indicates the test set kind (if is the test set (0) or the train set (1) ) of the run.
        writeExpOut - determines is an output file with expected-real output has to be writen.

      • doScreenStatistics

        public void doScreenStatistics(int tStamp,
                               int exploitNum,
                               int[] statisticVector,
                               int[] globalResults)

        It computes the statistics

        Parameters:
        tStamp - is the time of the UCS.
        exploitNum - is the number of exploits that UCS has made.
        statisticVector - is the vector that contains all the statistics
        globalResults - is a vector with the global results statistics.

      • doTestScreenStatistics

        public void doTestScreenStatistics(int tStamp,
                                   int[] globalResults,
                                   int numProblems)

        It does test screen statistics

        Parameters:
        tStamp - is the system time.
        globalResults - is the sum of all statistics done in the system.
        numProblems - is the number of examples done in the run.

      • createAndInitArray

        public int[] createAndInitArray(int N)
        Creates and initializes an integer vector of size N
        Parameters:
        N - is the size of the vector that has to be created

      • finishUCS

        public void finishUCS(long iTime)

        It makes the last things to do after closing the program. It upgrades the times, print the last statistics and close all opened files.

        Parameters:
        iTime - is the actual time.

      • print

        public void print(java.io.BufferedReader r)
        Does print the population and stops the execution.
        Parameters:
        r - is the bufferedReader where to read.
